cause.description:
The Foundation’s programs focus on two primary areas: historical preservation and education. They work closely with the Writers Guild of America to provide a number of services and programs to both working writers and the public.
This includes:
* maintaining the Writers Guild Foundation Shavelson-Webb Library, that houses over 15,000 film and television scripts.
* promoting literacy and writing programs in Los Angeles, including school-based writing workshops for at-risk teens, K-12 school programs and school/classroom visits.
* sponsoring educational seminars, panel discussions, screenings, classes and other writer events, including Writers on Writing, Writers on Genre, Spring Storytellers and regular summer craft events.
You can find more info here:
http://www.wgfoundation.org
1. Preserve the history of screenwriting as an art form.
2. Promote writing for film and television as literature in its own right.
3. Provide opportunities for writers to give back to their own and to the larger community.
4. Raise public consciousness about the importance of good writing in the collaborative arts of film and television.
5. Collect and preserve the best and most representative film and television writing.
cause.mission: preserve and promote excellence in writing and to advance the recognition of the writer’s unique contribution to the art of film and television.
